events.name: Software Defined Networking for the SD-WAN and Data Centre
events.description: You will learn flexible NFV deployment strategy to reduce capex & opex, how to avoid vendor lock-in using white box approach, how to future-proof your network, vSwicth offload and so on. We have a privilege to have Randy Fitton (Director of BD & Sales, Noviflow), a veteran in network & telco technology, to share his thoughts on future-proofing your networking. Randy Fitton has twenty-seven years of experience in the telecommunications industry. Managing large and start-up teams for a variety of technical areas such as: SDN, NFV, OpenStack, OpenDaylight, datacentre, mobile broadband implementation and optimization, OSS/BSS including delivery of the services on the cloud, traffic management, service creation and network policy control for fixed, 3GPP and 3GPP2 environments, IMS, content cache, ad insertion, threat mitigation, network management and network demographics solutions (for fixed, wireless, IPTV and NGN networks), WiMax, LMDS, NGN fixed/mobile with H.323 and SIP, IPTV, managed services, unified messaging and traditional broadband networking appliances and software. A Permanent Resident of Singapore since 2005. Randy has resided in Korea, Japan, Malaysia, China and Singapore while supporting business in the entire AsiaPac region. NoviFlow provides “Carrier Grade” SDN performance - large data centre operators and service providers will only fully embrace NFV and SDN once solutions meet their performance requirements: scalability, wire speed, dynamic programmability, and transparent multi-tenancy. NoviSwitch - NoviFlow’s OpenFlow switches utilise network processors that combine the speed of an ASIC with the openness and programmability of a vSwitch. Consequently, we offer high performance Ethernet switches that can meet the requirements of large data centre operators and service providers. High-Performance SDN Solutions - at NoviFlow we've developed solutions that leverage the unique capabilities of SDN and OpenFlow to solve real customer problems, that preserve existing investments in both capital and organizational competencies. Scale-Out Router - use SDN and OpenFlow to implement a fully functional, centrally controlled and reliable network router that is easier to scale more economical to operate. Data Centre Gateways - the network edge is becoming a major bottleneck for traffic and revenue growth. SDN can help resolve these challenges at the DC edge. VSwitch Offload – a vSwitch Offload solution that will reduce capital expenditures by up to ~45% over an Open vSwitch solution. Intelligent TOR Switches - the Cloud, and virtualisation all require the same agility and flow management capabilities at the Top-of-Rack as is normally expected at the network edge. SDN provides a whole new set of tools for managing data growth, multi tenancy and traffic isolation.  This event is sponsored by Noviflow. Pizza will be provided starting 6pm. Please bring your namecards and join our networking session.  For those who drive, the site is at the opposite of IMM shopping mall (Jurong East). Please drive through the Toh Guan Road near Furniture Mall and proceed towards the end of the road until you see Datwyler's signboard.  For those who walk, you can take Jurong East MRT and follow J-Walk to IMM, then cross the bridge to the site. Please walk towards the back of the warehouse complex until you see Datwyler's signboard.
events.location: Datwyler, 30 Toh Guan Road #01-01A (Opp IMM, near Furniture Mall).  , Singapore

All welcome!! * IF there is any change in place i will let you know in advance Thanks To Redhat for sponsoring it again !!!

events.name: iOS Dev Scout May Meetup
events.description:
"Grab promo codes to be given to attendees"  


Venue: Grab R&D Center, 138 Cecil Street, Cecil Court, Singapore - 069538 Nearby MRT: Telok Ayer, Raffles Place 


Speakers:  • Kenneth Andersson - Director of Engineering (Mobile), Grab • Ming Ming - iOS Developer, Grab • Madushan Gamage - Software Engineer, iBuy Group 



Agenda: • 6:30pm - Come, network, have dinner • 7:15pm - 1st Talk - What has changed in app development since it started. App Development Evolution and Future - by Kenneth • 7:45pm - Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) in iOS - what are the tools there to help us. - by Ming Ming • 8:15pm - iOS Accessibility - by Madushan 



About the Topics: • Kenneth has been focusing on the mobile space for the last 10 years (even before we heard of apps!). He will share his experiences and views on the shifting nature of mobile, especially in app development from “nice to have” marketing gimmicks to being the core asset of many organizations such as for fast-growing tech startup, Grab where the app defines almost the whole business. App developers, being highly sought after, what does the future look like for these high in demand professionals. • An introduction to Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) and the advantages frequent integrations bring to app development in large teams. Ming Ming will also focus on how to evaluate CI/CD tools together with the platforms and aspects to consider.  • iOS comes with assistive features that allow people with disabilities to experience the fun and function of iOS. Madushan will speak about accessibility features and APIs and how to let people with disabilities use your apps.
events.location: Grab R&D Center, 138 Cecil Street, Cecil Court, 069538, Singapore

events.name: Data Science in Marketing
events.description: In this month's meetup, we'll discuss how data science can be used in marketing. Speakers include Nirmal Palaparthi, Analytics Expert and Consultant, Aman Narain, Chief Executive of Bank Bazaar International and a surprise guest. About the speakers and panelists:  Aman Narain is the Chief Executive of Bank Bazaar International, India’s leading financial website backed by Amazon, Fidelity Growth Partners & Sequoia. Prior to this he was the Global Head of Digital Banking for Standard Chartered with responsibility for all direct to consumer channels, including Online, Mobile & ATM’s. He also managed all internal digital channels and social media. In his previous role, Aman transformed a set of subscale and substandard channels into one of the largest and most preferred digital real estates serving over 10 million people in 35 markets. He accomplished this in six years working with a multi award winning team of 600 people who he recruited and developed globally. In 2011, Aman was recognised as one of the eight global leaders changing Banking and Technology, and has since pioneered a number of industry firsts across Social Media, Mobile Banking and Payments. These have resulted in multiple industry accolades including two Webby Awards and being recognized as the “World’s Best Internet Bank” for the last three years consecutively by Global Finance Magazine. Having designed and delivered a radically simplified digital platform, Aman remains passionate about Business, Technology and Design and writes about this on his blog amanwhoblogs.com, is widely quoted in the media and is a popular speaker at events globally. He is also a strong advocate of diversity in the workplace, having built a gender balanced leadership team that has pioneered a progressive work culture and collaborated with the Singapore Government on community firsts including the “Mobile Ventures Fellowship (MoVe)” for Singapore graduates and “Silver Lining” which bridges the digital divide for senior citizens. Aman graduated with honours in International Relations & Economics from Ohio Wesleyan University. It is here that Aman became passionate about leadership and was elected to lead his student government and was recognized as an outstanding leader for numerous leadership roles he played. This passion continued during his MBA at INSEAD. Aman lives in Singapore with his wife, his two daughters and their cocker spaniel.  Nirmal Palaparthi co-founded Fractal Analytics, a global analytics firm that helps Fortune 500 companies gain competitive advantage through deep understanding of consumers and better data driven decisions. --------------------------------------------------------------------- Special thanks to our host NUS Enterprise.

events.name: Analytics.CLUB Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer
events.description:
Analytics.Club's Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer About the Event: Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer networking event is conducted every last Thursday of the month. This event will primarily focus on building networks to initiate good conversations on data science across different venues around the town. The monthly event will be Networking only mixer (Just plain and simple networking with no long sales pitch or knowledge sessions) envisioned to keep local data science professionals connected. You will use the opportunity to exchange contact information, seek opportunities, and connect with fellow data science professionals and build deeper connected networks. When: Last Thursday of the Month Time: 6:30 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. Location: CATO (237 south bridge road, Singapore) Refreshments/Drinks: Buy Your Own Drink/Meal 


Put name tag with following initials in circle (optional, for effective networking): a. (B) for Business Background  b. (C) for Coding Background  c. (S) for Statistician Background  d. (T) for Technology Background  e. (M) for Math / Modeling Background

events.name: Talk.CSS #6
events.description: We're back for another round! Latest CSS news by Talk.CSS Our new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. Converter by William LimOn putting measurement converters on the web Other speakers TBA. Also, if you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. Any CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.

events.name: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.description: Coursera is re-running the hugely popular an brilliant "Functional Programming Principles in Scala" course taught by Martin Odersky, the inventor of Scala. I would wholeheartedly recommend this course to  anyone interested in learning to write better Scala, beginners and experts alike.   Singapore Scala Programmers will be organizing a study group for this course so that people have an opportunity to work on the assignments, discuss the material and help out anyone that may be stuck or confused.  These will be weekly and on Thursdays so that people have enough time to watch the videos beforehand and enough time to complete the assignments.  The course is also part of a Coursera specialization "Functional Programming in Scala" so anyone who is doing the other courses in that specialization ("Functional Program Design in Scala" and "Parallel Programming") is also most welcome.  Looking forward to seeing you there....
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: Gophers Meetup #15 - May 2016
events.description: Agenda: - Thread safe testing in Golang, Zhao Chang - GraphQL in Go , Hafiz Ismail - Mini Quiz This event will start around at 7:30pm. Pizza starts from 7:15 pm. If you have any project or talk to share, please don't hesitate to contact us at sg.gopher@gmail.com
Mike Curtis, VP of Engineering at Airbnb will be in Singapore and we have the opportunity to sit down and chat with him! Join us as we speak with him on Thursday, May 26th at 6pm!
events.location: Carousell HQ, Blk 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-14, Singapore 139951
events.name: Carousell TechTalk: Fireside Chat with Mike Curtis - VP Engineering, Airbnb
ArtScience Late: We're Everywhere, Somewhere and Nowhere
events.description:
We're Everywhere, Somewhere and Nowhere
A Project by Bani Haykal
Thursday, 26 May, 8pm

Curious about life in the 21st century? Try to be. Hello world. We are a couple, from Singapore and we'd like to share with you what life is like in unnatural environments and circumstances; where the wilderness is a lolcat riddled with emojis and your life quantified by your browsing history. Is this a performance? Maybe. But at this stage of our existence, we are always performing for someone.

Free admission. In conjunction with the opening of Big Bang Data exhibition.
